meanings.definition: A wedge-shaped stone or brick used in building to form a corner or angle.
meanings.sent1: The mason carefully placed the quoinings to create a sturdy corner.
meanings.sent2: The architect admired the intricate quoinings on the old building.
meanings.sent3: The quoinings in the wall seemed to be gossiping about the other bricks.
meanings.sent4: The quoinings stood out like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The quoinings jutted out, defining the edge of the structure.

meanings.definition: The arrangement of such stones or bricks in a building.
meanings.sent1: The quoinings along the facade added a touch of elegance to the building.
meanings.sent2: The quoinings were expertly aligned, showcasing the craftsmanship of the construction.
meanings.sent3: The quoinings in the wall looked like a carefully crafted pattern.
meanings.sent4: The quoinings formed a solid foundation for the structure, both physically and aesthetically.
meanings.sent5: The quoinings created a striking contrast against the smooth bricks.
